title: Simple harmonic motion - block on spring pushed

content.question: A cart is attached to a horizontal spring and pulled back from its equilibrium position, which is indicated by the dashed line, to Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, as shown. When the cart is released from rest, it moves through Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, then continues to undergo simple harmonic motion. If, instead of being released from rest, the cart is given a push to the left at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, which of the following claims about the motion of the cart is correct?

choices.label: The spring will exert a force with a greater magnitude on the cart at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> than in the first scenario.
The spring will exert a force with a smaller magnitude on the cart at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> than in the first scenario.
The cart will have the same acceleration at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> as it did in the first scenario.
The cart will reach equilibrium at a different position than in the first scenario.

content.answer: The cart will have the same acceleration at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> as it did in the first scenario.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
